title: 2015–16 Scottish League Cup
text:
The 2015–16 <a href="Scottish%20League%20Cup">Scottish League Cup</a> was the 70th season of <a href="Scotland">Scotland</a>'s second-most prestigious <a href="Association%20football">football</a> knockout competition. It is also known as The Scottish League Cup presented by Utilita for sponsorship reasons.
<a href="Ross%20County%20F.C.">Ross County</a> defeated <a href="Hibernian%20F.C.">Hibernian</a> 2–1 in the <a href="2016%20Scottish%20League%20Cup%20Final%20%28March%29">final</a> on 13 March.
Format.
The competition is a <a href="Single-elimination%20tournament">single elimination</a> knock-out competition. In each round, fixtures are determined by random draw, with the first to third rounds seeded according to last season's league positions (higher 50% of finishers drawn v lower 50% of finishers, alternating which is at home with each tie drawn).
Fixtures are played to a finish, with <a href="Overtime%20%28sports%29">extra time</a> and then penalties used in the event of draws. The competition is open to all clubs in the <a href="Scottish%20Professional%20Football%20League">Scottish Professional Football League</a>. Clubs involved in European competitions are given a bye to the third round to avoid congestion of fixtures.
Qualified teams.
The following teams qualified and competed in the 2015–16 Scottish League Cup.
Scottish Premiership teams.
There are 12 teams from the <a href="2014%E2%80%9315%20Scottish%20Premiership">2014–15 Scottish Premiership</a>.
Scottish Championship teams.
There are 10 teams from the <a href="2014%E2%80%9315%20Scottish%20Championship">2014–15 Scottish Championship</a>.
Scottish League One teams.
There are 10 teams from the <a href="2014%E2%80%9315%20Scottish%20League%20One">2014–15 Scottish League One</a>.
Scottish League Two teams.
There are 10 teams from the <a href="2014%E2%80%9315%20Scottish%20League%20Two">2014–15 Scottish League Two</a>.
First round.
The first round draw took place on Monday 6 July 2015 at 2:30pm BST at the <a href="Hampden%20Park">Hampden Park Stadium</a>. The 30 clubs that participated in the Championship, League One and League Two in the 2014–15 season entered the competition at this stage. The 12 clubs that participated in the 2014–15 Scottish Premiership received a bye.
Second round.
The second round draw took place on Monday 3 August 2015 at 2:30pm BST at the <a href="Hampden%20Park">Hampden Park Stadium</a>. The clubs that finished in the bottom 7 places of last season's Premiership entered at this stage joining the 15 first round winners.
Third round.
The third round draw took place on Thursday 27 August 2015 at 2:30pm BST at the <a href="Hampden%20Park">Hampden Park Stadium</a>. The 4 clubs that participated in the <a href="2014%E2%80%9315%20Scottish%20Premiership">2014–15 Scottish Premiership</a> season and qualified for European competition entered the competition at this stage along with <a href="Dundee%20United%20F.C.">Dundee United</a>, the highest placed non-Europe qualifying side.
Quarter-Finals.
Draw and Seeding.
The quarter-final draw took place on Monday 28 September 2015 at 2:30pm at <a href="Hampden%20Park">Hampden Park</a>, all teams were placed in the same pot.
Semi-Finals.
Draw and seeding.
The semi-final draw took place on Monday 9 November 2015 at 2:00pm at <a href="Hampden%20Park">Hampden Park</a>, all teams were placed in the same pot.
